      • checkMoveFromCol

        public static java.lang.String checkMoveFromCol(java.lang.String moveFromCol)
        Checks the validity of first input
        Parameters:
        moveFromCol - represents the column number to move card from, or the command of exit, restart, and rotate
        Returns:
        returns input entered if input is valid or else returns "i"

      • checkMoveToCol

        public static java.lang.String checkMoveToCol(java.lang.String moveToCol)
        Checks the validity of column number to move card to
        Parameters:
        moveToCol - column number to move card to
        Returns:
        returns column number if valid or else returns "i"

      • rotate

        public static void rotate(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>[] pilesAndCols)
        Moves the last element to the front of specified column
        Parameters:
        pilesAndCols - Array with four piles and nine columns
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if non-numeric input is entered
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if column is empty

      • command

        public static java.lang.String command(Card _cards,
                                       Column _cols,
                                       java.util.Stack<java.lang.String> deck,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>[] pilesAndCols,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> multipleCards)
        Commands of the moving card from and to columns, and piles
        Parameters:
        _cards - object of Card class
        _cols - object of Column class
        deck - stack of fifty-two cards
        pilesAndCols - Array with four piles and nine columns
        multipleCards - ArrayList with multiple consecutive cards
        Returns:
        input of volumn number to move card from
        Throws:
        java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - wrong input of one character card
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - invalid card input
